content:
Hi all, we're excited about and following this project. I know there's a lot of work to be done with the refactor, but is there a ballpark target date scheduled for the v0.3.0 release?

Thanks!

Not currently, but after a few more minor tweaks and additions to wit syntax I can make a tag and try to get the rust stuff published on crates.io as well. Date wise I suppose by the end of the month hopefully

crates.io: Rust Package Registry

Awesome, thanks... I did see the README.md update yesterday, looks promising! Happy to hear about crates.io as well.

One more follow up question -- Resources were removed since v0.2.0, and I heard from Mossaka above that he believes there's plans to bring them back. Are these slated for v0.3.0?

crates.io: Rust Package Registry

There's currently no official reelase process or cadence for wit-bindgen, prior tags were purely ad-hoc. In that sense there's no plans for v0.3.0 in the sense of being "official", but it probably makes sense to do at some point in the near future, hence why I mused above about possibly by the end of the month.

As for resources, they're going to come back, and it's going to take some time. Not by the end of the month.
